Package model.map

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.map.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The class map represents the arena of the game. There are 4 different map configurations, each one has different rooms, colors and spawn points Each map is coded into the map*.json files
    Author:
    edoardo
    See Also:

      • getSpawnSquareFromColor

        public Square getSpawnSquareFromColor​(Color color)
        This method is used to get the spawn point as a square given the color of the room (each room has one spawn point)
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the room
        Returns:
        Spawn point square in the given color's room
        See Also:
        Color

      • getAllowedMoves

        public java.util.List<Directions> getAllowedMoves​(Square square)
        getAllowedMoves tells me which moves i can do from a specific square
        Parameters:
        square - square is the starting point from the allowed moves are checked
        Returns:
        Returns a list of squares, the ones in allowed directions from the input square. Return null if there are no allowed moves (never)
        See Also:
        Square

      • getVisibileRooms

        public java.util.List<Color> getVisibileRooms​(Square square)
        getVisibleRooms: with this information the player is able to know the rooms and then who can see.
        Parameters:
        square - square is the starting point for the evaluation of the visible rooms
        Returns:
        returns a list containing the colors of the visible rooms
        See Also:
        Square

      • getSquare

        public Square getSquare​(Directions direction,
                        Square startingSquare)
        This method is used to get ad adiacent square from a starting point is a certain direction
        Parameters:
        direction - direction is the wanted direction in which to search
        startingSquare - startingSquare is the starting point for the evaluation
        Returns:
        returns a square reference to the square near the input square
        See Also:
        Square, Directions

        Returns:

      • getAllSquaresInDirection

        public java.util.List<Square> getAllSquaresInDirection​(Directions direction,
                                                       Square square)
        This method returns all (without using rules, such as moving through walls) the squares in a certain direction from a square starting point
        Parameters:
        direction - direction to analyze
        square - square starting point
        Returns:
        return a list of ALL the squares in a direction
        See Also:
        Directions, Square

      • getAllowedSquaresInDirection

        public java.util.List<Square> getAllowedSquaresInDirection​(Directions direction,
                                                           Square square)
        This method gives back all the allowed (if there is a wall the evaluation stops) in a certain direction
        Parameters:
        direction - direction to analyze
        square - square is the starting point for the evaluation
        Returns:
        gives in return a list of all allowed squares in a direction
        See Also:
        Directions, Square
